page.title: 17THE COBHAM NEWS AND MAIL
page.content:
These were the the main news items in the paper between July 3rd and July 10th .
A major article dealt with the growing drug problem in Elmbridge and there was an interview with Dr. Mike Tristam who runs the Surrey Drugline information service.
The Ombudsman was brought in to investigate a council decision in withdrawing sheltered housing status from a group of 7 bungalows and 8 flats in Middleton Road, Cobham. The Ombudsman found the council guilty and so the council apologised and paid compensation to a group of elderly Cobham residents.
Police are investigating some vandalism to cars in Esher.
